VA-01 families are feeling the effects of the Biden Administration’s continued inaction on our supply chain crisis. I am proud that my fellow Republicans and I are committed to addressing the supply chain crisis by incentivizing work and reducing reliance on foreign imports.

An often forgotten cog in our supply chain is the Wooden Pallet industry. Prices for wooden pallets have increased 66% due to price volatility in the lumber market, coupled with worker shortages causes increased prices on everyday products.
@NatResources These supply chain problems are only being amplified by the Biden Admin. policies regarding the COVID-19 Vaccine Mandates.

It was great to join @NatResources Republican forum to address the ongoing supply chain crisis and the effects of supply shortages, price increases, and outrageous product delays on American families, especially during the holiday season.

The Majority plans to raise taxes on the working-class to pay for their $3.5 trillion spending spree. They call it a corporate income tax hike, but they know as well as we do that 70% of corporate tax hikes are paid by workers in the form of wages and employment. https://t.co/fppWbL80j6

The Democrat-led $3.5 trillion spending package includes tax breaks for the rich masked as tax credits for electric vehicles. These tax credits reward Democrat union allies while incentivizing other manufacturers to move jobs overseas. American workers deserve better.

Resorting to authoritarian tactics like vaccine mandates only heightens public distrust of the vaccine, and exacerbates one of the greatest obstacles to vaccination.

Bravo to my friend,  @RepGarretGraves, who has been tirelessly working  for his district during today’s Natural Resources markup while helping those whose homes and lives have been devastated by Hurricane Ida. Truly an exceptional Member of Congress and proud Louisianian.

H.R.2609, The Naval Readiness Act: Provides oversight over U.S. Navy vessels by making permanent the requirement for an annual report on the material condition of Navy ships, expanding this report to make it more meaningful for both the taxpayer and Congress alike.

H.R.5108, The 1st Lt. Hugh Conor McDowell Safety in Armed Forces Equipment Act of 2021: Explores the incorporation of blackboxes in tactical vehicles, allowing data collection on prospective safety improvements for our servicemembers.
H.R. 5147, Prohibiting the Secretary of Defense from procuring personal protective equipment from certain non-allied foreign nations, and for other purposes.

H.R.4935, SWOLE Act (Amended): Improves the retention of Surface Warfare Officers (SWO) by investigating root causes to female retention shortfalls, and increases the marketability of SWOs by credentialing them as mariners: a win-win for the Navy and the Merchant Marines alike.

H.R.4987, The Global Force Management Oversight Act: Requires an annual report on the Global Force Management Allocation Plan (GFMAP) and briefing on major changes to the GFMAP throughout the year. This  makes sure our tax-payer dollars reflect the priorities of the NDS.

H.R.4861, The COBIA Act: Ensures schools educating service-connected children receive the full sum of federal impact aid to which they are currently entitled. A big win for school districts near military installations.

H.R.5104, The Just In Case Act: Establishes Special Emergency Reimbursement Authority for the Dept of Defense, similar to that provided by Sec. 3610 of the CARES Act, to allow contractors be reimbursed if they are unable to work on-site due to a pandemic.
Passage of this year's NDAA will include passage of 7 standalone bill I have previously introduced. These bills are:

As part of this year’s NDAA, I also helped to secure almost $100 million for Naval Surface Warfare Center Dahlgren in Virginia’s First District. This funding will be used to expand high powered electric weapons research and cyber capabilities for the United States Navy.

During yesterday’s NDAA markup, @HASCRepublicans and I secured 6 additional ships, on top of the previously planned 7, as well as retained 3 cruisers.

The construction, maintenance, and repair of these ships will bring new jobs and economic growth to the Commonwealth of Virginia

@8SparkyGrl8 Presently, my office is assisting dozens of families in my district to obtain SIV’s for close relatives in Afghanistan. I appreciate your passion for this issue and will continue to do everything I can to assist these efforts.

@8SparkyGrl8 Hello Anna, I authored a letter urging the Administration to fix issues with the SIV program in anticipation of issues such as these months ago. I also voted in favor of legislation to make SIV’s easier to obtain for those who served alongside US forces.
